content:
Here is the cleaned up text:

You are here: 
SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SERVICE CLOUD
Create Public Groups for Knowledge

Salesforce Knowledge uses public groups to assign users specific tasks related to articles. When you assign article actions to a public group, you can grant users the ability to publish articles with a specified validation status.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience


Salesforce Knowledge is available in Essentials and Unlimited Editions with Service Cloud.

USER PERMISSIONS
NEEDED
To create or edit a public group: Manage Users

For example, when a member of the Candidate public group submits an article with status Work in Progress for approval, it is automatically approved and published.

From Setup, enter Public Groups in the Quick Find box.
Click New, or click Edit next to the group you want to edit.
Enter the following information:
Field	Description
Label	The name used to refer to the group in any user interface pages.
Group Name (public groups only)	The unique name used by the API and managed packages.

To allow automatic access to records using your role hierarchies, select Grant Access Using Hierarchies. If deselected, users that are higher in the role hierarchy don't receive automatic access.

From the Search dropdown, select the type of member to add.
Select members from the Available Members box, and click Add to add them to the group.
Click Save.

Now assign only the necessary actions to your groups so the selected members can perform their tasks while keeping the integrity of your knowledge base.
title: Understanding Salesforce Knowledge Public Groups
